translated: The title on the outside: The Record of the Japanese Monk Enchin's Study of Buddhism in Tang China
Record
Guoqing Temple on Mount Tiantai

The Record of the Japanese Monk Enchin of Enryakuji Temple in the Capital City of Mount Hiei, who Studied Buddhism in Tang China, arrived at Chang'an City and obtained the teachings of the Vairocana School.
These diagrams and ritual implements.
And Guoqing Chan Forest Temple, etc.
He obtained the teachings spoken by the Great Master Zhizhe.
These stele inscriptions, etc.
And various chapters and commentaries obtained from other families in the prefectures.
A total of 341 copies.
772 fascicles.
And Sanskrit-wrapped Dharma objects, etc.
A total of 17 items before and after.
The names and descriptions are listed below.
The teachings of the Vairocana School, including diagrams and ritual implements, a total of 117 copies of teachings and diagrams.
158 fascicles.
A total of ten items.

In the autumn of the great middle year of Enchin,
he just arrived in Fuzhou and saw the Tripiá¹­aka master.

Respectfully recorded.
Recorded by the monk Enchin of Japan, who sought the Dharma in the Tang, on the tenth day of the tenth month in the eleventh year of the Dazhong era of the Great Tang.
